triples.evidence: T1 tells us how quickly a tissue’s magnetization realigns with the main magnetic field, B zero.
triples.o: how quickly a tissue’s magnetization realigns with the main magnetic field, B zero

triples.evidence: This exponential recovery is the hallmark of T1 relaxation.
The recovery speed depends on the tissue type, because different tissues exchange energy with their environment-the so-called spin-lattice interaction-at different rates.

concepts.term: These differences in T1 times are one of the key sources of image contrast in MRI.

evidence: The recovery speed depends on the tissue type, because different tissues exchange energy with their environment-the so-called spin-lattice interaction-at different rates.
T1 describes how the longitudinal magnetization, that is, the component along the z-axis, gradually returns to its equilibrium value after being disturbed by a radiofrequency pulse.
The recovery speed depends on the tissue type, because different tissues exchange energy with their environment-the so-called spin-lattice interaction-at different rates.
The differences in T1 times are one of the key sources of image contrast in MRI.
